item.title: mtrack
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: mtrack is a project management, source browser, wiki and issue tracking tool heavily inspired by the popular Trac software. via mtrack – software development tracker. About every five months I get a strong desire to write a clone of Trac. I like the features, but the setup, admin, customization and management aspects are a pain. […]
item.content:encoded:
mtrack is a project management, source browser, wiki and issue tracking tool heavily inspired by the popular Trac software.

via mtrack – software development tracker.

About every five months I get a strong desire to write a clone of Trac. I like the features, but the setup, admin, customization and management aspects are a pain. Something like mtrack looks interesting enough that I may give it a try.

item.title: SVN-Notify, Linking To Trac Revisions
item.dc:creator: josephscott
item.description: Matt made it so that the revision number shown in SVN-Notify links to the Trac diff page for that revision. This was for the wp-svn list, but no reason it couldn’t be used elsewhere. Figured I might need something like this one day, so here it is: /usr/local/bin/svnnotify -r $REV -C -d -H HTML::ColorDiff -p […]
item.content:encoded:
Matt made it so that the revision number shown in SVN-Notify links to the Trac diff page for that revision. This was for the wp-svn list, but no reason it couldn’t be used elsewhere.

Figured I might need something like this one day, so here it is:

/usr/local/bin/svnnotify -r $REV -C -d -H HTML::ColorDiff -p $REPOS 
-t wp-svn@lists.automattic.com 
--from m@wordpress.org 
--reply-to wp-hackers@lists.automattic.com 
--revision-url http://trac.wordpress.org/changeset/%s 
--ticket-map '(#(d+))=http://trac.wordpress.org/ticket/%s' 
--ticket-regex '([(d+)])' 
--ticket-url http://trac.wordpress.org/changeset/%s

And here’s Matt’s email to wp-hackers that explains it a bit more.
